comments.raw_text:
When a context menu is triggered by the mouse, it doesn't make sense to underline the access keys (and Windows and other MS apps on Windows 7 do not underline in this case.) When the menu is triggered by the keyboard, this underline does make sense (and Windows and other MS apps on Windows 7 do underline in this case.) 

We should remove the underlines for access keys in context menus when the menu was triggered by a right click. This will make them visually cleaner and easier to navigate as well as bringing us in line with Windows 7 standards.
comments.creator: asa@mozilla.com
